  24. class DashboardView(LoginRequiredMixin, ListView):
  26. """View for dashboard"""
  28. model = Service
  29. queryset = Service.objects.all().select_related().order_by("status", "-log__created").annotate(date=Max('log__created'))
  30. context_object_name = 'services'
  31. template_name = "ftp_deploy/dashboard.html"
  32. paginate_by = 25
  34. def post(self, request, *args, **kwargs):
  35. services = self.get_queryset()
  36. if self.request.POST['services']:
  37. services = services.filter(pk=self.request.POST['services'])
  38. return render_to_response('ftp_deploy/service/list.html', locals(), context_instance=RequestContext(request))
  41. class ServiceManageView(LoginRequiredMixin, DetailView):
  43. """View for manage services"""
  45. model = Service
  46. context_object_name = 'service'
  47. template_name = "ftp_deploy/service/manage.html"
  49. def get_context_data(self, **kwargs):
  50. context = super(ServiceManageView, self).get_context_data(**kwargs)
  51. context['recent_logs'] = self.object.log_set.all()[:15]
  52. context['fail_logs'] = self.object.log_set.filter(status=0).filter(skip=0)
  53. return context
  56. class ServiceAddView(LoginRequiredMixin, CreateView):
  58. """View for add serives"""
  59. model = Service
  60. form_class = ServiceForm
  61. template_name = "ftp_deploy/service/form.html"
  63. def form_valid(self, form):
  64. messages.add_message(self.request, messages.SUCCESS, 'Service has been added.')
  65. return super(ServiceAddView, self).form_valid(form)
  67. def get_success_url(self):
  68. self.object.check()
  69. self.object.save()
  70. return reverse('ftpdeploy_service_manage', kwargs={'pk': self.object.pk})
  73. class ServiceEditView(LoginRequiredMixin, UpdateView):

  82. self.object.save()
  83. messages.add_message(self.request, messages.SUCCESS, 'Service has been updated.')

  103. class ServiceStatusView(JSONResponseMixin, LoginRequiredMixin, SingleObjectMixin, View):
  105. """View for update(save) and check service status"""
  107. model = Service
  109. def post(self, request, *args, **kwargs):
  110. service = self.get_object()
  111. service.check()
  112. service.save()
  113. response = request.POST.get('response', '')
  115. if response == 'list':
  116. services = [service]
  117. return render_to_response('ftp_deploy/service/list.html', locals(), context_instance=RequestContext(request))
  119. if response == 'manage':
  120. manage_view = ServiceManageView()
  121. manage_view.object = service
  122. context = manage_view.get_context_data()
  123. return render_to_response('ftp_deploy/service/manage.html', context, context_instance=RequestContext(request))
  125. if response == 'json':
  126. context = {
  127. 'status': service.status,
  128. 'status_message': service.status_message,
  129. 'updated': service.updated
  130. }
  131. return self.render_json_response(context)
  133. raise Http404
  136. class ServiceRestoreView(LoginRequiredMixin, DetailView):
  138. """"View for build restore path for service"""
  140. model = Service
  141. prefetch_related = ["log_set"]
  142. template_name = "ftp_deploy/service/restore-modal.html"
  144. def get_context_data(self, **kwargs):
  145. context = super(ServiceRestoreView, self).get_context_data(**kwargs)
  147. service = self.get_object()
  148. logs = service.get_logs_tree()
  150. # init payload dictionary
  151. context['payload'] = json.loads(logs[0].payload)
  153. if service.repo_source == 'bb':
  154. context['payload']['user'] = 'Restore'
  155. elif service.repo_source == 'gh':
  156. context['payload']['pusher']['name'] = 'Restore'
  158. context['service'] = service
  160. commits = list()
  161. for log in logs:
  162. payload = json.loads(log.payload)
  163. commits += payload['commits']
  165. context['payload']['commits'] = commits
  166. context['payload'] = json.dumps(context['payload'])
  168. context['files_added'], context['files_modified'], context['files_removed'] = commits_parser(commits,service.repo_source).file_diff()
  169. context['commits_info'] = commits_parser(commits,service.repo_source).commits_info()
  171. return context
  173. def post(self, request, *args, **kwargs):
  174. if self.get_object().lock():
  175. return HttpResponse(status=500)
  177. return HttpResponse(reverse('ftpdeploy_deploy', kwargs={'secret_key':self.get_object().secret_key}))
